explanation.text:
Explanation
After Jesus entered Jerusalem, he went to the temple where he chase away, the money changers and those who were transacting business in the temple. From Jerusalem,  he left them and went out of the city to Bethany, where he spent the night.
Read Matthew 21:1-17

subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Acts 27:42 The soldiers planned to kill the prisoners to prevent any of them from swimming away and escaping. 43 But the centurion wanted to spare Paul’s life and kept them from carrying out their plan. He ordered those who could swim to jump overboard first and get to land.

it was not lawful to kill

text: ...Gor the Son of man also came not to be served but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many, This statement was made by Jesus

options.text: after healing two blind men near Jericho
immediately before he told the parable of the householder
during the discussion that followed the request of the sons of Zebedee
as he was foretelling his crucifixion and resurrection

subject: CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE CRK

explanation.text:
Explanation
Herod Antipas had wanted to see Jesus for a long time, hoping to observe one of the miracles of Jesus.
Herold was also the same man who had previously ordered the death of John the Baptist and, according to some Pharisees, had plotted to have Jesus killed as well.

text: Herod was very glad to see Jesus at the trial because

options.text: John the Baptist spoke to him about Jesus
he believed that Jesus was the Messiah
he hoped to see Jesus perform some miracles
the quarrel between Herod and Pilate was settled on account of Jesus

explanation.text:
Explanation
Stephen was accused of blasphemy at his trial he then made a speech denouncing the Jewish authorities who were sitting in judgment on him and he was then stoned to death. The last thing Stephen did before being stoned to death was him condemning the Jewish authority who had convened to judge him for blasphemy

text: The immediate cause of the stoning of Stephen was his

options.text: claiming to see Jesus at the right hand of God
declaration of Jesus as the Righteous One
condemnation of the Jewish rite of circumcision

text: Saul's encounter with the risen Christ on the road to Damascus convinced him that
